      </div>
      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>1. apply the change.diff and compile Chromium with ASAN<span class="line"><!---->1. apply the change.diff and compile Chromium with ASAN<!----></span><br>2. put navigation.html, nav1.html together and start a server. Note that this needs a non-IP address domain, I use <span class="line"><!---->2. put navigation.html, nav1.html together and start a server. Note that this needs a non-IP address domain, I use <!----></span>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span>mytest.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://mytest.com"><!---->mytest.com<!----></a>" here.<span class="line"><!---->" here.<!----></span><br>3. run `./chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/noexist --enable-features=NtpChromeCartModule,ContextMenuPerformanceInfoAndRemoteHintFetching --disable-popup-blocking --no-sandbox  <span class="line"><!---->3. run `./chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/noexist --enable-features=NtpChromeCartModule,ContextMenuPerformanceInfoAndRemoteHintFetching --disable-popup-blocking --no-sandbox  <!----></span>http://mytest.com:8605/navigation.html`<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://mytest.com:8605/navigation.html`"><!---->http://mytest.com:8605/navigation.html`<!----></a><br><br>This is a render crash, so we need `--no-sandbox` to get the symbols.<span class="line"><!---->This is a render crash, so we need `--no-sandbox` to get the symbols.<!----></span><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br>1. Analysis<span class="line"><!---->1. Analysis<!----></span><br><br>In function `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoad`[1], it will pass a callback `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback` to `OnNavigation`(1). And we can call `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoad` more than once, so, in one `CommerceHintAgent`, there could be more than one callback `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback` waiting for run.<span class="line"><!---->In function `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoad`[1], it will pass a callback `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback` to `OnNavigation`(1). And we can call `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoad` more than once, so, in one `CommerceHintAgent`, there could be more than one callback `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback` waiting for run.<!----></span><br><br>```[1]<span class="line"><!---->```[1]<!----></span><br>void CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoad(<span class="line"><!---->void CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoad(<!----></span><br>    ui::PageTransition transition) {<span class="line"><!---->    ui::PageTransition transition) {<!----></span><br>  if (!starting_url_.is_valid())<span class="line"><!---->  if (!starting_url_.is_valid())<!----></span><br>    return;<span class="line"><!---->    return;<!----></span><br>  DCHECK(starting_url_.SchemeIsHTTPOrHTTPS());<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK(starting_url_.SchemeIsHTTPOrHTTPS());<!----></span><br>  should_use_dom_heuristics_.reset();<span class="line"><!---->  should_use_dom_heuristics_.reset();<!----></span><br>  mojo::Remote<mojom::CommerceHintObserver> observer =<span class="line"><!---->  mojo::Remote&lt;mojom::CommerceHintObserver&gt; observer =<!----></span><br>      GetObserver(render_frame());<span class="line"><!---->      GetObserver(render_frame());<!----></span><br>  if (!commerce::kOptimizeRendererSignal.Get()) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (!commerce::kOptimizeRendererSignal.Get()) {<!----></span><br>    DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback(starting_url_, std::move(observer), false,<span class="line"><!---->    DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback(starting_url_, std::move(observer), false,<!----></span><br>                                     mojom::Heuristics::New());<span class="line"><!---->                                     mojom::Heuristics::New());<!----></span><br>    return;<span class="line"><!---->    return;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>  auto* observer_ptr = observer.get();<span class="line"><!---->  auto* observer_ptr = observer.get();<!----></span><br>  observer_ptr->OnNavigation(<span class="line"><!---->  observer_ptr-&gt;OnNavigation(<!----></span><br>      starting_url_, CommerceHeuristicsData::GetInstance().GetVersion(),<span class="line"><!---->      starting_url_, CommerceHeuristicsData::GetInstance().GetVersion(),<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(&CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback, // (1) callback is passed <span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(&amp;CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback, // (1) callback is passed <!----></span><br>                     weak_factory_.GetWeakPtr(), starting_url_,<span class="line"><!---->                     weak_factory_.GetWeakPtr(), starting_url_,<!----></span><br>                     std::move(observer)));<span class="line"><!---->                     std::move(observer)));<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>In callback `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback`, the `starting_url_` will be set to a null GURL() [2]. Therefore, if there are two `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback` executing consecutively, the latter will use a null `starting_url_`, but there is no check. This `starting_url_.PathForRequestPiece()`(2) will return a string of length -1, but this will be covert to an unsigned integer 0xffffffffffffffff. The use of any element of this string will cause an overflow.<span class="line"><!---->In callback `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback`, the `starting_url_` will be set to a null GURL() [2]. Therefore, if there are two `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback` executing consecutively, the latter will use a null `starting_url_`, but there is no check. This `starting_url_.PathForRequestPiece()`(2) will return a string of length -1, but this will be covert to an unsigned integer 0xffffffffffffffff. The use of any element of this string will cause an overflow.<!----></span><br><br>```[2]<span class="line"><!---->```[2]<!----></span><br>void CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback(<span class="line"><!---->void CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback(<!----></span><br>    const GURL& url,<span class="line"><!---->    const GURL&amp; url,<!----></span><br>    mojo::Remote<mojom::CommerceHintObserver> observer,<span class="line"><!---->    mojo::Remote&lt;mojom::CommerceHintObserver&gt; observer,<!----></span><br>    bool should_skip,<span class="line"><!---->    bool should_skip,<!----></span><br>    mojom::HeuristicsPtr heuristics) {<span class="line"><!---->    mojom::HeuristicsPtr heuristics) Affected versions<span class="line"><!---->2. Affected versions<!----></span><br><br>This problem is introduced in this commit: <span class="line"><!---->This problem is introduced in this commit: <!----></span>8694e1c99e688be202e3118727b8978ec173babe<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/8694e1c99e688be202e3118727b8978ec173babe"><!---->8694e1c99e688be202e3118727b8978ec173babe<!----></a><br>Because this commit add the callback `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback`<span class="line"><!---->Because this commit add the callback `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback`<!----></span><br><br>The Dev channel is updated to  109.0.5396.2, and it is affected by this vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->The Dev channel is updated to  109.0.5396.2, and it is affected by this vulnerability.<!----></span><br>The Beta channel is updated to 108.0.5359.30, and it is affected by this vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->The Beta channel is updated to 108.0.5359.30, and it is affected by this vulnerability.<!----></span><br><br><br>The Stable channel is updated to 107.0.5304.87, which doesn't have the callback, so it is not affected by this vulnerability<span class="line"><!---->The Stable channel is updated to 107.0.5304.87, which doesn't have the callback, so it is not affected by this vulnerability<!----></span><br><br>3. POC<span class="line"><!---->3. POC<!----></span><br>In my poc, you need to patch the logic of browser to simulate a signed-in user with more than one profiles:<span class="line"><!---->In my poc, you need to patch the logic of browser to simulate a signed-in user with more than one profiles:<!----></span><br>```[3]<span class="line"><!---->```[3]<!----></span><br>// On Android, commerce hint observer is enabled for all users with the feature<span class="line"><!---->// On Android, commerce hint observer is enabled for all users with the feature<!----></span><br>// enabled since the observer is only used for collecting metrics for now, and<span class="line"><!---->// enabled since the observer is only used for collecting metrics for now, and<!----></span><br>// we want to maximize the user population exposed; on Desktop, ChromeCart is<span class="line"><!---->// we want to maximize the user population exposed; on Desktop, ChromeCart is<!----></span><br>// not available for non-signin single-profile users and therefore neither does<span class="line"><!---->// not available for non-signin single-profile users and therefore neither does<!----></span><br>// commerce hint observer.<span class="line"><!---->// commerce hint observer.<!----></span><br>#if !BUILDFLAG(IS_ANDROID)<span class="line"><!---->#if !BUILDFLAG(IS_ANDROID)<!----></span><br>  Profile* profile =      frame_host-&gt;GetProcess()-&gt;GetBrowserContext());<!----></span><br>  auto* identity_manager = IdentityManagerFactory::GetForProfile(profile);<span class="line"><!---->  auto* identity_manager class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br><br>Also note that flag `ContextMenuPerformanceInfoAndRemoteHintFetching` is not necessary, it is just used to pass this check `IsUserPermittedToFetchFromRemoteOptimizationGuide`[4]. You could let the `IsUserConsentedToAnonymousDataCollectionAndAllowedToFetchFromRemoteService` return true to pass this check.<span class="line"><!---->Also note that flag `ContextMenuPerformanceInfoAndRemoteHintFetching` is not necessary, it is just used to pass this check `IsUserPermittedToFetchFromRemoteOptimizationGuide`[4]. This is a necessity to keep our patch gap as small as possible and help protect our users from n-day exploitation of from unshipped security fixes. Thank you! :)<span class="line"><!---->In the future, please update all fixed security bugs as Fixed once the resolving CL is landed to ensure we can review and approve security fixes for merge review as soon as possible.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         Hi Krace, the mitigation here is not that the user is login to a google account or even more than one profile, that is very standard and expected behavior that we would consider very much within a standard threat model. The mitigation that resulted in this bug being rated and rewarded as moderately mitigated here is that there is a race condition, one that is very visible to the user.<span class="line"><!---->Hi Krace, the mitigation here is not that the user is login to a google account or even more than one profile, that is very standard and expected behavior that we would consider very much within a standard threat model. The mitigation that resulted in this bug being rated and rewarded as moderately mitigated here is that there is a race condition, one that is very visible to the user.<!----></span><br><br>I hope that explanation helps!<span class="line"><!---->I hope that explanation helps!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>1. apply the change.diff and compile Chromium with ASAN<span class="line"><!---->1. apply the change.diff and compile Chromium with ASAN<!----></span><br>2. put navigation.html, nav1.html together and start a server. Note that this needs a non-IP address domain, I use <span class="line"><!---->2. put navigation.html, nav1.html together and start a server. Note that this needs a non-IP address domain, I use <!----></span>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span>mytest.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://mytest.com"><!---->mytest.com<!----></a>" here.<span class="line"><!---->" here.<!----></span><br>3. run `./chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/noexist --enable-features=NtpChromeCartModule,ContextMenuPerformanceInfoAndRemoteHintFetching --disable-popup-blocking --no-sandbox  <span class="line"><!---->3. run `./chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/noexist --enable-features=NtpChromeCartModule,ContextMenuPerformanceInfoAndRemoteHintFetching --disable-popup-blocking --no-sandbox  <!----></span>http://mytest.com:8605/navigation.html`<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://mytest.com:8605/navigation.html`"><!---->http://mytest.com:8605/navigation.html`<!----></a><br><br>This is a render crash, so we need `--no-sandbox` to get the symbols.<span class="line"><!---->This is a render crash, so we need `--no-sandbox` to get the symbols.<!----></span><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br>1. Analysis<span class="line"><!---->1. Analysis<!----></span><br><br>In function `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoad`[1], it will pass a callback `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback` to `OnNavigation`(1). And we can call `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoad` more than once, so, in one `CommerceHintAgent`, there could be more than one callback `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback` waiting for run.<span class="line"><!---->In function `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoad`[1], it will pass a callback `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback` to `OnNavigation`(1). And we can call `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoad` more than once, so, in one `CommerceHintAgent`, there could be more than one callback `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback` waiting for run.<!----></span><br><br>```[1]<span class="line"><!---->```[1]<!----></span><br>void CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoad(<span class="line"><!---->void CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoad(<!----></span><br>    ui::PageTransition transition) {<span class="line"><!---->    ui::PageTransition transition) {<!----></span><br>  if (!starting_url_.is_valid())<span class="line"><!---->  if (!starting_url_.is_valid())<!----></span><br>    return;<span class="line"><!---->    return;<!----></span><br>  DCHECK(starting_url_.SchemeIsHTTPOrHTTPS());<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK(starting_url_.SchemeIsHTTPOrHTTPS());<!----></span><br>  should_use_dom_heuristics_.reset();<span class="line"><!---->  should_use_dom_heuristics_.reset();<!----></span><br>  mojo::Remote<mojom::CommerceHintObserver> observer =<span class="line"><!---->  mojo::Remote&lt;mojom::CommerceHintObserver&gt; observer =<!----></span><br>      GetObserver(render_frame());<span class="line"><!---->      GetObserver(render_frame());<!----></span><br>  if (!commerce::kOptimizeRendererSignal.Get()) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (!commerce::kOptimizeRendererSignal.Get()) {<!----></span><br>    DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback(starting_url_, std::move(observer), false,<span class="line"><!---->    DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback(starting_url_, std::move(observer), false,<!----></span><br>                                     mojom::Heuristics::New());<span class="line"><!---->                                     mojom::Heuristics::New());<!----></span><br>    return;<span class="line"><!---->    return;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>  auto* observer_ptr = observer.get();<span class="line"><!---->  auto* observer_ptr = observer.get();<!----></span><br>  observer_ptr->OnNavigation(<span class="line"><!---->  observer_ptr-&gt;OnNavigation(<!----></span><br>      starting_url_, CommerceHeuristicsData::GetInstance().GetVersion(),<span class="line"><!---->      starting_url_, CommerceHeuristicsData::GetInstance().GetVersion(),<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(&CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback, // (1) callback is passed <span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(&amp;CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback, // (1) callback is passed <!----></span><br>                     weak_factory_.GetWeakPtr(), starting_url_,<span class="line"><!---->                     weak_factory_.GetWeakPtr(), starting_url_,<!----></span><br>                     std::move(observer)));<span class="line"><!---->                     std::move(observer)));<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>In callback `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback`, the `starting_url_` will be set to a null GURL() [2]. Therefore, if there are two `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback` executing consecutively, the latter will use a null `starting_url_`, but there is no check. This `starting_url_.PathForRequestPiece()`(2) will return a string of length -1, but this will be covert to an unsigned integer 0xffffffffffffffff. The use of any element of this string will cause an overflow.<span class="line"><!---->In callback `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback`, the `starting_url_` will be set to a null GURL() [2]. Therefore, if there are two `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback` executing consecutively, the latter will use a null `starting_url_`, but there is no check. This `starting_url_.PathForRequestPiece()`(2) will return a string of length -1, but this will be covert to an unsigned integer 0xffffffffffffffff. The use of any element of this string will cause an overflow.<!----></span><br><br>```[2]<span class="line"><!---->```[2]<!----></span><br>void Affected versions<span class="line"><!---->2. Affected versions<!----></span><br><br>This problem is introduced in this commit: <span class="line"><!---->This problem is introduced in this commit: <!----></span>8694e1c99e688be202e3118727b8978ec173babe<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/8694e1c99e688be202e3118727b8978ec173babe"><!---->8694e1c99e688be202e3118727b8978ec173babe<!----></a><br>Because this commit add the callback `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback`<span class="line"><!---->Because this commit add the callback `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback`<!----></span><br><br>The Dev channel is updated to  109.0.5396.2, and it is affected by this vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->The Dev channel is updated to  109.0.5396.2, and it is affected by this vulnerability.<!----></span><br>The Beta channel is updated to 108.0.5359.30, and it is affected by this vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->The Beta channel is updated to 108.0.5359.30, and it is affected by this vulnerability.<!----></span><br><br><br>The Stable channel is updated to 107.0.5304.87, which doesn't have the callback, so it is not affected by this vulnerability<span class="line"><!---->The Stable channel is updated to 107.0.5304.87, which doesn't have the callback, so it is not affected by this vulnerability<!----></span><br><br>3. POC<span class="line"><!---->3. POC<!----></span><br>In my poc, you need to patch the logic of browser to simulate a signed-in user with more than one profiles:<span class="line"><!---->In my poc, you need to patch the logic of browser to simulate a signed-in user with more than one profiles:<!----></span><br>```[3]<span class="line"><!---->```[3]<!----></span><br>// On Android, commerce hint observer is enabled for all users with the feature<span class="line"><!---->// On Android, commerce hint observer is enabled for all users with the feature<!----></span><br>// enabled since the observer is only used for collecting metrics for now, and<span class="line"><!---->// enabled since the observer is only used for collecting metrics for now, and<!----></span><br>// we want to maximize the user population exposed; on Desktop, ChromeCart is<span class="line"><!---->// we want to maximize the user population exposed; on Desktop, ChromeCart is<!----></span><br>// not available for non-signin single-profile users and therefore neither does<span class="line"><!---->// not available for non-signin single-profile users and therefore neither does<!----></span><br>// commerce hint observer.<span class="line"><!---->// commerce hint observer.<!----></span><br>#if !BUILDFLAG(IS_ANDROID)<span class="line"><!---->#if !BUILDFLAG(IS_ANDROID)<!----></span><br>  Profile* profile = class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br><br>Also note that flag `ContextMenuPerformanceInfoAndRemoteHintFetching` is not necessary, it is just used to pass this check `IsUserPermittedToFetchFromRemoteOptimizationGuide`[4]. You could let the `IsUserConsentedToAnonymousDataCollectionAndAllowedToFetchFromRemoteService` return true to pass this check.<span class="line"><!---->Also note that flag `ContextMenuPerformanceInfoAndRemoteHintFetching` is not necessary, it is just used to pass this check `IsUserPermittedToFetchFromRemoteOptimizationGuide`[4].         This bug seems legitimate to me. What I haven't determined is the set of circumstances for this to happen in practice, which makes gauging the risk to users harder. I'm triaging as High for now, but I might lower this depending on my further analysis.<span class="line"><!---->This bug seems legitimate to me.         Thanks for the filing! This looks legit to me as well, we didn't realize that DidCommitProvisionalLoad could be called for multiple times in one navigation. The original post was correct, this change has not reached Stable channel yet. I'll come up with a fix and see if we can merge it to M108; if not, I'll revert the culprit CL that introduces the code path.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the filing! This looks legit to me as well, we didn't realize that DidCommitProvisionalLoad could be called for multiple times in one navigation. The original post was correct, this change has not reached Stable channel yet. I'll come up with a fix and see if we can merge it to M108; if not, I'll revert the culprit CL that introduces the code path.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hi yuezhanggg@, apologies if this mucks with your workflow, however, security merge review and release process are reliant on bugs being marked Fixed. This allows the bot to update the issue with the appropriate merge request labels (as you can see in <span class="line"><!---->Hi yuezhanggg@, apologies if this mucks with your workflow, however, security merge review and release process are reliant on bugs being marked Fixed. This allows the bot to update the issue with the appropriate merge request labels (as you can see in <!----></span>comment #10<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c10"><!---->comment #10<!----></a>) and get it into our security merge review queue. <span class="line"><!---->) and get it into our security merge review queue. <!----></span><br>Please refer to <span class="line"><!---->Please refer to <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/process/merge_request.md#Security-merge-triage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/process/merge_request.md#Security-merge-triage"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/process/merge_request.md#Security-merge-triage<!----></a><br><br>In the future, please update all fixed security bugs as Fixed once the resolving CL is landed to ensure we can review and approve security fixes for merge review as soon as possible. This is a necessity to keep our patch gap as small as possible and help protect our users from n-day exploitation of from unshipped security fixes. Thank you! :)<span class="line"><!---->In the future, please update all fixed security bugs as Fixed once the resolving CL is landed to ensure we can review and approve security fixes for merge review as soon as possible.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hi amyressler@, thank you for your explanation.<span class="line"><!---->Hi amyressler@, thank you for your explanation.<!----></span><br>But this issue only needs to login in a Google Accout, so I have to patch the browser code.         Hi Krace, the mitigation here is not that the user is login to a google account or even more than one profile, that is very standard and expected behavior that we would consider very much within a standard threat model. The mitigation that resulted in this bug being rated and rewarded as moderately mitigated here is that there is a race condition, one that is very visible to the user.<span class="line"><!---->Hi Krace, the mitigation here is not that the user is login to a google account or even more than one profile, that is very standard and expected behavior that we would consider very much within a standard threat model. The mitigation that resulted in this bug being rated and rewarded as moderately mitigated here is that there is a race condition, one that is very visible to the user.<!----></span><br><br>I hope that explanation helps!<span class="line"><!---->I hope that explanation helps!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>1. apply the change.diff and compile Chromium with ASAN<span class="line"><!---->1. apply the change.diff and compile Chromium with ASAN<!----></span><br>2. put navigation.html, nav1.html together and start a server. Note that this needs a non-IP address domain, I use <span class="line"><!---->2. put navigation.html, nav1.html together and start a server. Note that this needs a non-IP address domain, I use <!----></span>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span>mytest.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://mytest.com"><!---->mytest.com<!----></a>" here.<span class="line"><!---->" here.<!----></span><br>3. run `./chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/noexist --enable-features=NtpChromeCartModule,ContextMenuPerformanceInfoAndRemoteHintFetching --disable-popup-blocking --no-sandbox  <span class="line"><!---->3. run `./chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/noexist --enable-features=NtpChromeCartModule,ContextMenuPerformanceInfoAndRemoteHintFetching --disable-popup-blocking --no-sandbox  <!----></span>http://mytest.com:8605/navigation.html`<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://mytest.com:8605/navigation.html`"><!---->http://mytest.com:8605/navigation.html`<!----></a><br><br>This is a render crash, so we need `--no-sandbox` to get the symbols.<span class="line"><!---->This is a render crash, so we need `--no-sandbox` to get the symbols.<!----></span><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br>1. Analysis<span class="line"><!---->1. Analysis<!----></span><br><br>In function `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoad`[1], it will pass a callback `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback` to `OnNavigation`(1). And we can call `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoad` more than once, so, in one `CommerceHintAgent`, there could be more than one callback `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback` waiting for run.<span class="line"><!---->In function `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoad`[1], it will pass a callback `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback` to `OnNavigation`(1). And we can call `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoad` more than once, so, in one `CommerceHintAgent`, there could be more than one callback `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback` waiting for run.<!----></span><br><br>```[1]<span class="line"><!---->```[1]<!----></span><br>void CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoad(<span class="line"><!---->void CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoad(<!----></span><br>    ui::PageTransition transition) {<span class="line"><!---->    ui::PageTransition transition) {<!----></span><br>  if (!starting_url_.is_valid())<span class="line"><!---->  if (!starting_url_.is_valid())<!----></span><br>    return;<span class="line"><!---->    return;<!----></span><br>  DCHECK(starting_url_.SchemeIsHTTPOrHTTPS());<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK(starting_url_.SchemeIsHTTPOrHTTPS());<!----></span><br>  should_use_dom_heuristics_.reset();<span class="line"><!---->  should_use_dom_heuristics_.reset();<!----></span><br>  mojo::Remote<mojom::CommerceHintObserver> observer =<span class="line"><!---->  mojo::Remote&lt;mojom::CommerceHintObserver&gt; observer =<!----></span><br>      GetObserver(render_frame());<span class="line"><!---->      GetObserver(render_frame());<!----></span><br>  if (!commerce::kOptimizeRendererSignal.Get()) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (!commerce::kOptimizeRendererSignal.Get()) {<!----></span><br>    DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback(starting_url_, std::move(observer), false,<span class="line"><!---->    DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback(starting_url_, std::move(observer), false,<!----></span><br>                                     mojom::Heuristics::New());<span class="line"><!---->                                     mojom::Heuristics::New());<!----></span><br>    return;<span class="line"><!---->    return;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>  auto* observer_ptr = observer.get();<span class="line"><!---->  auto* observer_ptr = observer.get();<!----></span><br>  observer_ptr->OnNavigation(<span class="line"><!---->  observer_ptr-&gt;OnNavigation(<!----></span><br>      starting_url_, CommerceHeuristicsData::GetInstance().GetVersion(),<span class="line"><!---->      starting_url_, CommerceHeuristicsData::GetInstance().GetVersion(),<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(&CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback, // (1) callback is passed <span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(&amp;CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback, // (1) callback is passed <!----></span><br>                     weak_factory_.GetWeakPtr(), starting_url_,<span class="line"><!---->                     weak_factory_.GetWeakPtr(), starting_url_,<!----></span><br>                     std::move(observer)));<span class="line"><!---->                     std::move(observer)));<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>In callback `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback`, the `starting_url_` will be set to a null GURL() [2]. Therefore, if there are two `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback` executing consecutively, the latter will use a null `starting_url_`, but there is no check. This `starting_url_.PathForRequestPiece()`(2) will return a string of length -1, but this will be covert to an unsigned integer 0xffffffffffffffff. The use of any element of this string will cause an overflow.<span class="line"><!---->In callback `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback`, the `starting_url_` will be set to a null GURL() [2]. Therefore, if there are two `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback` executing consecutively, the latter will use a null `starting_url_`, but there is no check. This `starting_url_.PathForRequestPiece()`(2) will return a string of length -1, but this will be covert to an unsigned integer 0xffffffffffffffff. The use of any element of this string will cause an overflow.<!----></span><br><br>```[2]<span class="line"><!---->```[2]<!----></span><br>void CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback(<span class="line"><!---->void CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback(<!----></span><br>    const GURL& url,<span class="line"><!---->    const GURL&amp; url,<!----></span><br>    mojo::Remote<mojom::CommerceHintObserver> observer,<span class="line"><!---->    mojo::Remote&lt;mojom::CommerceHintObserver&gt; observer,<!----></span><br>    bool should_skip,<span class="line"><!---->    bool should_skip,<!----></span><br>    mojom::HeuristicsPtr heuristics) {<span class="line"><!---->    mojom::HeuristicsPtr heuristics) {<!----></span><br>  should_skip_ = should_skip;<span class="line"><!---->  should_skip_ = should_skip;<!----></span><br>  if (should_skip)<span class="line"><!---->  if (should_skip)<!----></span><br>    return;<span class="line"><!---->    return;<!----></span><br>  if (!heuristics->version_number.empty() &&<span class="line"><!---->  if (!heuristics-&gt;version_number.empty() &amp;&amp;<!----></span><br>      heuristics->version_number !=<span class="line"><!---->      heuristics-&gt;version_number !=<!----></span><br>          CommerceHeuristicsData::GetInstance().GetVersion()) {<span class="line"><!---->          CommerceHeuristicsData::GetInstance().GetVersion()) {<!----></span><br>    bool is_populated =<span class="line"><!---->    bool is_populated =<!----></span><br>        CommerceHeuristicsData::GetInstance().PopulateDataFromComponent(<span class="line"><!----> Affected versions<span class="line"><!---->2. Affected versions<!----></span><br><br>This problem is introduced in this commit: <span class="line"><!---->This problem is introduced in this commit: <!----></span>8694e1c99e688be202e3118727b8978ec173babe<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/8694e1c99e688be202e3118727b8978ec173babe"><!---->8694e1c99e688be202e3118727b8978ec173babe<!----></a><br>Because this commit add the callback `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback`<span class="line"><!---->Because this commit add the callback `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback`<!----></span><br><br>The Dev channel is updated to  109.0.5396.2, and it is affected by this vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->The Dev channel is updated to  109.0.5396.2, and it is affected by this vulnerability.<!----></span><br>The Beta channel is updated to 108.0.5359.30, and it is affected by this vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->The Beta channel is updated to 108.0.5359.30, and it is affected by this vulnerability.<!----></span><br><br><br>The Stable channel is updated to 107.0.5304.87, which doesn't have the callback, so it is not affected by this vulnerability<span class="line"><!---->The Stable channel is updated to 107.0.5304.87, which doesn't have the callback, so it is not affected by this vulnerability<!----></span><br><br>3. POC<span class="line"><!---->3. POC<!----></span><br>In my poc, you need to patch the logic of browser to simulate a signed-in user with more than one profiles:<span class="line"><!---->In my poc, you need to patch the logic of browser to simulate a signed-in user with more than one profiles:<!----></span><br>```[3]<span class="line"><!---->```[3]<!----></span><br>// On Android, commerce hint observer is enabled for all users with the feature<span class="line"><!---->// On Android, commerce hint observer is enabled for all users with the feature<!----></span><br>// enabled since the observer is only used for collecting metrics for now, and<span class="line"><!---->// enabled since the observer is only used for collecting metrics for now, and<!----></span><br>// we want to maximize the user population exposed; on Desktop, ChromeCart is<span class="line"><!---->// we want to maximize the user population exposed; on Desktop, ChromeCart is<!----></span><br>// not available for non-signin single-profile users and therefore neither does<span class="line"><!---->// not available for non-signin single-profile users and therefore neither does<!----></span><br>// commerce hint observer.<span class="line"><!---->// commerce hint observer.<!----></span><br>#if !BUILDFLAG(IS_ANDROID)<span class="line"><!---->#if !BUILDFLAG(IS_ANDROID)<!----></span><br>  Profile* profile =      frame_host-&gt;GetProcess()-&gt;GetBrowserContext());<!----></span><br>  auto* identity_manager = IdentityManagerFactory::GetForProfile(profile);<span class="line"><!---->  auto* identity_manager profile_manager-&gt;GetNumberOfProfiles() &lt;= 1)<!----></span><br>    return;<span class="line"><!---->    return;<!----></span><br>#endif<span class="line"><!---->#endif<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br><br>Also note that flag `ContextMenuPerformanceInfoAndRemoteHintFetching` is not necessary, it is just used to pass this check `IsUserPermittedToFetchFromRemoteOptimizationGuide`[4]. You could let the `IsUserConsentedToAnonymousDataCollectionAndAllowedToFetchFromRemoteService` return true to pass this check.<span class="line"><!---->Also note that flag `ContextMenuPerformanceInfoAndRemoteHintFetching` is not necessary, it is just used to pass this check `IsUserPermittedToFetchFromRemoteOptimizationGuide`[4].         Hi yuezhanggg@, apologies if this mucks with your workflow, however, security merge review and release process are reliant on bugs being marked Fixed. This allows the bot to update the issue with the appropriate merge request labels (as you can see in <span class="line"><!---->Hi yuezhanggg@, apologies if this mucks with your workflow, however, security merge review and release process are reliant on bugs being marked Fixed. This allows the bot to update the issue with the appropriate merge request labels (as you can see in <!----></span>comment #10<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c10"><!---->comment #10<!----></a>) and get it into our security merge review queue. <span class="line"><!---->) and get it into our security merge review queue. <!----></span><br>Please refer to <span class="line"><!---->Please refer to <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/process/merge_request.md#Security-merge-triage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/process/merge_request.md#Security-merge-triage"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/process/merge_request.md#Security-merge-triage<!----></a><br><br>In the future, please update all fixed security bugs as Fixed once the resolving CL is landed to ensure we can review and approve security fixes for merge review as soon as possible. This is a necessity to keep our patch gap as small as possible and help protect our users from n-day exploitation of from unshipped security fixes. Thank you! :)<span class="line"><!---->In the future, please update all fixed security bugs as Fixed once the resolving CL is landed to ensure we can review and approve security fixes for merge review as soon as possible.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion.         Hi Krace, the mitigation here is not that the user is login to a google account or even more than one profile, that is very standard and expected behavior that we would consider very much within a standard threat model. The mitigation that resulted in this bug being rated and rewarded as moderately mitigated here is that there is a race condition, one that is very visible to the user.<span class="line"><!---->Hi Krace, the mitigation here is not that the user is login to a google account or even more than one profile, that is very standard and expected behavior that we would consider very much within a standard threat model. The mitigation that resulted in this bug being rated and rewarded as moderately mitigated here is that there is a race condition, one that is very visible to the user.<!----></span><br><br>I hope that explanation helps!<span class="line"><!---->I hope that explanation helps!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>1. apply the change.diff and compile Chromium with ASAN<span class="line"><!---->1. apply the change.diff and compile Chromium with ASAN<!----></span><br>2. put navigation.html, nav1.html together and start a server. Note that this needs a non-IP address domain, I use <span class="line"><!---->2. put navigation.html, nav1.html together and start a server. Note that this needs a non-IP address domain, I use <!----></span>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span>mytest.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://mytest.com"><!---->mytest.com<!----></a>" here.<span class="line"><!---->" here.<!----></span><br>3. run `./chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/noexist --enable-features=NtpChromeCartModule,ContextMenuPerformanceInfoAndRemoteHintFetching --disable-popup-blocking --no-sandbox  <span class="line"><!---->3. run `./chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/noexist --enable-features=NtpChromeCartModule,ContextMenuPerformanceInfoAndRemoteHintFetching --disable-popup-blocking --no-sandbox  <!----></span>http://mytest.com:8605/navigation.html`<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://mytest.com:8605/navigation.html`"><!---->http://mytest.com:8605/navigation.html`<!----></a><br><br>This is a render crash, so we need `--no-sandbox` to get the symbols.<span class="line"><!---->This is a render crash, so we need `--no-sandbox` to get the symbols.<!----></span><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br>1. Analysis<span class="line"><!---->1. Analysis<!----></span><br><br>In function `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoad`[1], it will pass a callback `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback` to `OnNavigation`(1). And we can call `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoad` more than once, so, in one `CommerceHintAgent`, there could be more than one callback `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback` waiting for run.<span class="line"><!---->In function `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoad`[1], it will pass a callback `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback` to `OnNavigation`(1). And we can call `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoad` more than once, so, in one `CommerceHintAgent`, there could be more than one callback `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback` waiting for run.<!----></span><br><br>```[1]<span class="line"><!---->```[1]<!----></span><br>void CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoad(<span class="line"><!---->void CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoad(<!----></span><br>    ui::PageTransition transition) {<span class="line"><!---->    ui::PageTransition transition) {<!----></span><br>  if (!starting_url_.is_valid())<span class="line"><!---->  if (!starting_url_.is_valid())<!----></span><br>    return;<span class="line"><!---->    return;<!----></span><br>  DCHECK(starting_url_.SchemeIsHTTPOrHTTPS());<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK(starting_url_.SchemeIsHTTPOrHTTPS());<!----></span><br>  should_use_dom_heuristics_.reset();<span class="line"><!---->  should_use_dom_heuristics_.reset();<!----></span><br>  mojo::Remote<mojom::CommerceHintObserver> observer =<span class="line"><!---->  mojo::Remote&lt;mojom::CommerceHintObserver&gt; observer =<!----></span><br>      GetObserver(render_frame());<span class="line"><!---->      GetObserver(render_frame());<!----></span><br>  if (!commerce::kOptimizeRendererSignal.Get()) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (!commerce::kOptimizeRendererSignal.Get()) {<!----></span><br>    DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback(starting_url_, std::move(observer), false,<span class="line"><!---->    DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback(starting_url_, std::move(observer), false,<!----></span><br>                                     mojom::Heuristics::New());<span class="line"><!---->                                     mojom::Heuristics::New());<!----></span><br>    return;<span class="line"><!---->    return;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>  auto* observer_ptr = observer.get();<span class="line"><!---->  auto* observer_ptr = observer.get();<!----></span><br>  observer_ptr->OnNavigation(<span class="line"><!---->  observer_ptr-&gt;OnNavigation(<!----></span><br>      starting_url_, CommerceHeuristicsData::GetInstance().GetVersion(),<span class="line"><!---->      starting_url_, CommerceHeuristicsData::GetInstance().GetVersion(),<!----></span><br>      base::BindOnce(&CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback, // (1) callback is passed <span class="line"><!---->      base::BindOnce(&amp;CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback, // (1) callback is passed <!----></span><br>                     weak_factory_.GetWeakPtr(), starting_url_,<span class="line"><!---->                     weak_factory_.GetWeakPtr(), starting_url_,<!----></span><br>                     std::move(observer)));<span class="line"><!---->                     std::move(observer)));<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>In callback `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback`, the `starting_url_` will be set to a null GURL() [2]. Therefore, if there are two `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback` executing consecutively, the latter will use a null `starting_url_`, but there is no check. This `starting_url_.PathForRequestPiece()`(2) will return a string of length -1, but this will be covert to an unsigned integer 0xffffffffffffffff. The use of any element of this string will cause an overflow.<span class="line"><!---->In callback `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback`, the `starting_url_` will be set to a null GURL() [2]. Therefore, if there are two `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback` executing consecutively, the latter will use a null `starting_url_`, but there is no check. This `starting_url_.PathForRequestPiece()`(2) will return a string of length -1, but this will be covert to an unsigned integer 0xffffffffffffffff. The use of any element of this string will cause an overflow.<!----></span><br><br>```[2]<span class="line"><!---->```[2]<!----></span><br>void (IsAddToCart(starting_url_.PathForRequestPiece())) { // (2) null GURL().PathForRequestPiece will return a string of length -1<span class="line"><!---->  if Comments:<b class="line"><!---->Additional Comments:<!----></b><br>2. Affected versions<span class="line"><!---->2. Affected versions<!----></span><br><br>This problem is introduced in this commit: <span class="line"><!---->This problem is introduced in this commit: <!----></span>8694e1c99e688be202e3118727b8978ec173babe<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/8694e1c99e688be202e3118727b8978ec173babe"><!---->8694e1c99e688be202e3118727b8978ec173babe<!----></a><br>Because this commit add the callback `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback`<span class="line"><!---->Because this commit add the callback `CommerceHintAgent::DidCommitProvisionalLoadCallback`<!----></span><br><br>The Dev channel is updated to  109.0.5396.2, and it is affected by this vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->The Dev channel is updated to  109.0.5396.2, and it is affected by this vulnerability.<!----></span><br>The Beta channel is updated to 108.0.5359.30, and it is affected by this vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->The Beta channel is updated to 108.0.5359.30, and it is affected by this vulnerability.<!----></span><br><br><br>The Stable channel is updated to 107.0.5304.87, which doesn't have the callback, so it is not affected by this vulnerability<span class="line"><!---->The Stable channel is updated to 107.0.5304.87, which doesn't have the callback, so it is not affected by this vulnerability<!----></span><br><br>3. POC<span class="line"><!---->3. POC<!----></span><br>In my poc, you need to patch the logic of browser to simulate a signed-in user with more than one profiles:<span class="line"><!---->In my poc, you need to patch the logic of browser to simulate a signed-in user with more than one profiles:<!----></span><br>```[3]<span class="line"><!---->```[3]<!----></span><br>// On Android, commerce hint observer is enabled for all users with the feature<span class="line"><!---->// On Android, commerce hint observer is enabled for all users with the feature<!----></span><br>// enabled since the observer is only used for collecting metrics for now, and<span class="line"><!---->// enabled since the observer is only used for collecting metrics for now, and<!----></span><br>// we want to maximize the user population exposed; on Desktop, ChromeCart is<span class="line"><!---->// we want to maximize the user population exposed; on Desktop, ChromeCart is<!----></span><br>// not available for non-signin single-profile users and therefore neither does<span class="line"><!---->// not available for non-signin single-profile users and therefore neither does<!----></span><br>// commerce hint observer.<span class="line"><!---->// commerce hint observer.<!----></span><br>#if !BUILDFLAG(IS_ANDROID)<span class="line"><!---->#if !BUILDFLAG(IS_ANDROID)<!----></span><br>  Profile* profile = Profile::FromBrowserContext(<span class="line"><!---->  Profile* profile = Profile::FromBrowserContext(<!----></span><br>      frame_host->GetProcess()->GetBrowserContext());<span class="line"><!---->      frame_host-&gt;GetProcess()-&gt;GetBrowserContext());<!----></span><br>  auto* identity_manager = IdentityManagerFactory::GetForProfile(profile);<span class="line"><!---->  auto* identity_manager = IdentityManagerFactory::GetForProfile(profile);<!----></span><br>  ProfileManager* profile_manager = g_browser_process->profile_manager();<span class="line"><!---->  ProfileManager* profile_manager = g_browser_process-&gt;profile_manager();<!----></span><br>  if (!identity_manager || !profile_manager)<span class="line"><!---->  if (!identity_manager || !profile_manager)<!----></span><br> (!identity_manager-&gt;HasPrimaryAccount(signin::ConsentLevel::kSignin) &amp;&amp;<!----></span><br>      profile_manager->GetNumberOfProfiles() <= 1)<span class="line"><!---->      profile_manager-&gt;GetNumberOfProfiles() &lt;= 1)<!----></span><br>    return;<span class="line"><!---->    return;<!----></span><br>#endif<span class="line"><!---->#endif<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br><br>Also note that flag `ContextMenuPerformanceInfoAndRemoteHintFetching` is not necessary, it is just used to pass this check `IsUserPermittedToFetchFromRemoteOptimizationGuide`[4]. You could let the `IsUserConsentedToAnonymousDataCollectionAndAllowedToFetchFromRemoteService` return true to pass this check.<span class="line"><!---->Also note that flag `ContextMenuPerformanceInfoAndRemoteHintFetching` is not necessary, it is just used to pass this check `IsUserPermittedToFetchFromRemoteOptimizationGuide`[4]. You could let the `IsUserConsentedToAnonymousDataCollectionAndAllowedToFetchFromRemoteService` return true to pass this check.<!----></span><br><br>```[4]<span {<!----></span><br>  if (is_off_the_record)<span class="line"><!---->  if (is_off_the_record)<!----></span><br>    return false;<span class="line"><!---->    return false;<!----></span><br><br>  if (switches::ShouldOverrideCheckingUserPermissionsToFetchHintsForTesting()) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (switches::ShouldOverrideCheckingUserPermissionsToFetchHintsForTesting()) {<!----></span><br>    return true;<span class="line"><!---->    return true;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>  if (!features::IsRemoteFetchingEnabled())<span class="line"><!---->  if (!features::IsRemoteFetchingEnabled())<!----></span><br>    return false;<span class="line"><!---->    return false;<!----></span><br><br>  if (features::IsRemoteFetchingExplicitlyAllowedForPerformanceInfo())<span class="line"><!---->  if (features::IsRemoteFetchingExplicitlyAllowedForPerformanceInfo())<!----></span><br>    return true;<span         Thanks for the filing! This looks legit to me as well, we didn't realize that DidCommitProvisionalLoad could be called for multiple times in one navigation. The original post was correct, this change has not reached Stable channel yet. I'll come up with a fix and see if we can merge it to M108; if not, I'll revert the culprit CL that introduces the code path.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the filing! This looks legit to me as well, we didn't realize that DidCommitProvisionalLoad could be called for multiple times in one navigation. The original post was correct, this change has not reached Stable channel yet. I'll come up with a fix and see if we can merge it to M108; if not, I'll revert the culprit CL that introduces the code path.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hi yuezhanggg@, apologies if this mucks with your workflow, however, security merge review and release process are reliant on bugs being marked Fixed. This allows the bot to update the issue with the appropriate merge request labels (as you can see in <span class="line"><!---->Hi yuezhanggg@, apologies if this mucks with your workflow, however, security merge review and release process are reliant on bugs being marked Fixed. This allows the bot to update the issue with the appropriate merge request labels (as you can see in <!----></span>comment #10<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c10"><!---->comment #10<!----></a>) and get it into our security merge review queue. <span class="line"><!---->) and get it into our security merge review queue. <!----></span><br>Please refer to <span class="line"><!---->Please refer to <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/process/merge_request.md#Security-merge-triage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/process/merge_request.md#Security-merge-triage"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/process/merge_request.md#Security-merge-triage<!----></a><br><br>In the future, please update all fixed security bugs as Fixed once the resolving CL is landed to ensure we can review and approve security fixes for merge review as soon as possible. This is a necessity to keep our patch gap as small as possible and help protect our users from n-day exploitation of from unshipped security fixes. Thank you! :)<span class="line"><!---->In the future, please update all fixed security bugs as Fixed once the resolving CL is landed to ensure we can review and approve security fixes for merge review as soon as possible.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        Hi Krace, the mitigation here is not that the user is login to a google account or even more than one profile, that is very standard and expected behavior that we would consider very much within a standard threat model. The mitigation that resulted in this bug being rated and rewarded as moderately mitigated here is that there is a race condition, one that is very visible to the user.<span class="line"><!---->Hi Krace, the mitigation here is not that the user is login to a google account or even more than one profile, that is very standard and expected behavior that we would consider very much within a standard threat model. The mitigation that resulted in this bug being rated and rewarded as moderately mitigated here is that there is a race condition, one that is very visible to the user.<!----></span><br><br>I hope that explanation helps!<span class="line"><!---->I hope that explanation helps!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

          position: relative;

        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;

           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */

        for LitElement.

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {

 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
